content.description: Toprope the steep, short face 30 feet up and left of and around the corner from the start of Handlin' Snakeskin.

climbs.name: I Love Snakes
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Vicki Pelton, and Margy Floyd, February 1988.

content.description:
Same start as Handlin' Snakeskin, but after about 25 feet up, traverse right to vertical thin cracks. Follow the right branch of the cracks that leads up to a split in the summit block.

A direct start (5.10b R) has also been done.

climbs.name: Black Todd
climbs.fa: Dave Evans and Alan Bartlett, February 1988.

content.description: Start off the pointed boulder just right of I Love Snakes. Climb up to a right-leaning crack that peters out into face climbing up to a horizontal crack. Clip a bolt above the horizontal that protects face climbing (5.10b) up to a right-angle crack. Follow the crack around the corner to the right and up to the top.

climbs.name: Handlin' Sankeskin
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett and Dave Evans, February 1988.

content.description:
This is a steep and exciting route on nice patina located on the left side of Snake Dome's Southwest Face.

Climb a thin crack/seam past several horizontals. Where the thin crack ends, climb up and left (10c) on slightly runout face to the top.
content.protection: Pro to 3 inches, including a good selection of small nuts (RPs, Micro stoppers, etc.)
